conclusion: An ideal gas undergoes state changes from A to B to C. Temperature at A is 27°C.
The x-axis is volume (V) in units of 10^-3 m³, and the y-axis is pressure (p) in units of 10^5 Pa.
At point A, the pressure is 3 × 10^5 Pa and the volume is 1 × 10^-3 m³.
At point B, the pressure is 1 × 10^5 Pa and the volume is 1 × 10^-3 m³.
At point C, the pressure is 1 × 10^5 Pa and the volume is 3 × 10^-3 m³.

premise: Path is A to B to C: A to B is isochoric, B to C is isobaric.
conclusion: A to B is a constant volume process, B to C is a constant pressure process.
Temperature at A is 27°C, which is 300 K.
Ideal gas law: PV = nRT. Combined gas law: (P1V1)/T1 = (P2V2)/T2.

premise: A to B is isochoric. P1/T1 = P2/T2.
B to C is isobaric. V1/T1 = V2/T2.
Combined gas law for A to C: (P_A V_A)/T_A = (P_C V_C)/T_C.
